Topic.Title: I'm a little disappointed...

Message.Msg: In the last 4-5 Amazon stock performance is as good as Google, Apple. However, it's far behind Apple and Google in terms of making money. Most of its business are low margin business due to tough competition from stronger players, and no loyalty its customers(retail consumers are very sensitive about the price, only have loyalty to the price). So, the simple word to desribe Amazon stock is "it is a bubble". Some day if its growth becomes smaller(say less than 20%), its stock could drop more than 30% in a single trading day because its high PE ration(over 300) can not be justified. That's one of the reasons that the big inside sale(CEO/EVPs) in the last few weeks. If you are a real person as you said about yourself, go read some books before getting into the water too early. You also should figure out your investment goal(short terms trading as income or long terms growth, or a value player).

Message.Title: Seeking Alpha article--"What Amazon's 'Accounting Trick' Means for Your Investment" by Mathias Holmstrom
Message.Msg: This board no longer allows links, but the article can be found on the "Headlines" section for today. Halstrom states: "If cash flows are more important to you than earnings, then adjusted for leasing commitments makes Amazon look like a terrible investment, as adjusted free cash flows are negative." Halstrom places "fair value" for shares in the $150-203 range.

Topic.Title: No Volume / nO conviction

Message.Msg: PJ: This is in its death throws. As such, it is dangerous it will kill as many as possible before dying. I'll simply note that I find it fascinating all the hype is on the Kindle PaperWhite (same platform, no real growth) rather than new Kindle or HD... I'm more invested than typical (only 60% cash) because they've made my ideal positions sufficiently inexpensive that I've bought more. Having said that, very little in terms of cost or underlying is ST -- almost all into 2013. I've been fighting the squeezes for almost two years. Time is on my side now... FWIW, I have a killer long idea for you that is both safe and has enormous upside in a nominal inflation (or hyperinflation) world... I'll send an email -- it's on.
